replies.msg: A man of ethnic minority in Hong Kong was killed after being knelt on neck by police officers during the arrest. However, his death did not trigger an expected reaction among Hong Kong people who have been standing against police brutality for a long time. While there could be many explanations to their indifference to this tragedy, one may find a pretty satisfying answer when looking into a long existing social problem - racism in Hong Kong.

A man of ethnic minority in Hong Kong was killed after being knelt on neck by police officers during the arrest. However, his death did not trigger an expected reaction among Hong Kong people who have been standing against police brutality for a long time. While there could be many explanations to their indifference to this tragedy, one may find a pretty satisfying answer when looking into a long existing social problem - racism in Hong Kong.
